text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to specify that a beneficial interest under a constructive trust is an overriding interest under Schedule 3, Paragraph 2 of the Land Registration Act 2002. The candidate answer discusses the concept of overriding interests in Section 3, stating: \"If you had a beneficial interest (from contributions, renovation funding, common intention etc.) and you were in actual occupation, your interest may be an overriding interest binding a purchaser (and sometimes a mortgagee), even if it isn't registered.\" While this correctly links beneficial interest, actual occupation, and overriding interest status, it fails to explicitly cite the specific statutory provision required by the criterion: Schedule 3, Paragraph 2 of the Land Registration Act 2002. Therefore, the criterion is not strictly satisfied.", "criterion_id": "bcf34aa3-709c-4397-8296-31b8d2c9c2f1"}
